reviewText: The record of the brave and dedicated African American service men  and women during WWII has been a long time in coming.  This film will hopefully spark an interest in their invaluable service to their country at a crucial time in our history.  I thoroughly enjoyed the performances and story, especially the scenes in Ireland.

Powerful film about the only all black manned warship in WWII. Follows three young soldiers on to the U.S.S Mason as they experience war in a racially divided Navy. solid performances, including one of the last from Ossie Davis, combined with beautiful imagery and a great sense of story telling. Very educational and entertaining!
Proud
The war to remember!
This is a great movie  .
Loved the movie.  It's a shame soo many of the black soldiers were overlooked.  They played a crucial part in the war and gave their lives for this country

PROUD is an excellently produced piece, about a group of sailors and their unique accomplishments, that was "almost" lost in the shuffles of history due to those who tried to hide it. We are benefited by the glimpses we gained into the world of these brave sailors and the international arena in which they served so gallantly.
OK movie about the segregated military
Great movie about a true story
It was a good story, but the movie was weak in some areas.
Very insightful
Very informative, important history that had been obscured. Good to watch for black history month.
Movie was enjoyable but not great.
This movie is about true events and is not fiction. Americans people need to see this movie. A powerful and well acted documentary.
GREAT HISTORY
Great movie !!
just like Tuskegee airmen
Good bit of hidden history. African American military people finally acknowledged for their contributions to America's victory in WWII. Looking for more of this kind of movie/documentary.
Proud Movie I enjoyed it.

How could this movie get only 1 star?  I clicked on it because I love Navy movies and I had yet to see this one.  This movie had me spellbound.  Oscar worthy? Maybe not but it is definitely worth watching.  I loved it so much that I had to buy it so that I could watch it again.  Why not watch it while it is on Prime for free?  You will not have wasted any of your time.  This movie had me laughing, smiling and even crying.  One of the reasons is because of the indignity and discrimination that the black had suffered during this time in our country.  But yet they were willing to put their life on the line for our country.  I also hated the fact that their commendation that they should have received back then was not given to them just because of the color of their skin.  Ossie Davis, was a great actor and is missed.  Darnell Williams (All My Children) is in this also and does a great job.  The other 3 actors (I don't know their names) are great too.  It was also nice seeing. Denise Nicholas in this movie also, I loved her in Room 222.
Excellent movie. I never even knew about their story. It you like history this is a must to see
Bored
Poorly done
Interesting cast.
Great movie!
Ok. A little slow.
Great movie!
just ok
It was a great great movie.
Terrible

I'm giving this film 5 stars because it showed a side of the military during WWII that was rarely talked about before...the discrimination against blacks in the military by whites they served alongside.  This hit home for me because my grandfather was a sailor during WWII in the Pacific Ocean and I remember him telling me about the discrimination he and other black sailors faced.  He was not allowed to fight...until the war got extremely intense; then everyone (white & black) had to fight alongside each other...together.
Good
Ossie Davis is great in this film about a story of our  U.S. Navy.
I enjoyed it. I like history movies.

Excellent depiction of the difficulties and real life experiences of black servicemen, most of them highly qualified, who were nevertheless not meaningfully acknowledged for their valuable contributions in the Battle of the Atlantic.  At the time, due to prejudice in the navy, they were treated as second class citizens, not recognized for the valor they exhibited.  It was not until much late that they got the recognition they deserved.
Compelling story - sensed that it was more accurate than sensationalized.  These men deserve the credit and respect at the very least conferred on the Tuskegee Airman
A really fine movie. Such a shame it took so long for those proud men to get the recognition they richly deserved.
If you like movies of history? This is a must watch film.
This movie gives us a history lesson and reveals its effects on personnel relationships.
good one
Great piece of American history
I love was stories!  The movie is very interesting and moving!
Dreadfully disgusting language, much of which I believe not from the time period depicted
Another good story

Perhaps I'm just old.  I found this to be an excellent movie. The harsh reviews I think are unfair as this film is a history lesson - to the extent that it can be - as opposed to a film of entertainment and therefore special effects, moments of intense and suspense are not necessary.  Just tell the story and that's what this film does...albeit basic.  Yes, it does speak of America's racism and that is not a victimization, but a reality as to how it was.  My uncle who was a part of the infamous Red Ball Express told his story the same way...what he faced on these shores and abroad in terms of race, but also of how his unit overcame all that and changed the course of the war. Any Ossie Davis film is going to present this way or very similar so I knew what to expect. An excellent film for anyone who is interested in some basic history.
This was Great history of a true story about our unrecognized service men.
This movie was very informative and historical for black history.
LIKE IT
The history was interesting, but the acting left a lot to be desired, possibly because of the screen play writers.

Great!

Too much 'lecturing' on how horrible America was. NOTHING about the break through of blacks. So tired of them being victims and so tired of them marginalizing themselves with the mentality of being put down. EVERYONE has challenges and trials. Enough

another ship the USS Mason!

This is a good story, but the movie was made on a small budget. Ossie Davis is fine in his role, and I was surprised by a cameo appearance by Aidan Quinn. The rest of the actors are amateurish and wooden, which distracts from the quality of the story. I agree with another reviewer, who said that the examples of racism in the film also distract from the story. In one scene, the petty officer in charge of the sonar refuses to notify the captain of a possible u-boat contact because one of the black crewmen expressed his opinion that the captain should know about it. According to the filmmaker, this PO would rather risk his ship being sunk than send a warning about a possible u-boat to the captain. Pretty sure that never happened.

This film is a decent way to spend an hour and a half, just don't expect to be wildly entertained.

On the coat tails of the legendary Tuskegee Airmen or the 442 ..? ! A single bad weather escort captured on film, an evasive torpedo maneuver that saved the crew by a the orders of a Caucasian skipper? confirmed sub, surface or air kills? Not to disrespect the unfortunate government decisions during this time in history- job well done to the crew.
Not very good production values.  Seems to be made on the cheap.

While not the best movie in terms of cinematic quality, it brought home to this Caucasian male who was a long time naval buff that black sailors finally got their chance in WW2.  I was totally unaware of the story of the Mason and was glad to hear and see the story of their fight for our country in the face of such unabashed racism.  I was proud of their officers and their captains.  I am now a less ignorant man.  The contribution to the war effort that all of the races we mistreated then, and all too often now, is amazing and inspiring.

This is a story that needs telling, unfortunately this movie doesn't do it very well.

5 stars for a story that everyone should be aware of, especially of what these men went through during our history of segregation, kudos. Actual footage used in black in white throughout of the actual historical content including President Clinton's speech. However, acting left much to be desired rating at a 3, and, format was more like a documentary than a movie. Having rated it that way, it averages out to a 4 for me yet a very important part of history so well worth the watch.
Although the movie is presented as a war movie, this is about getting the recognition for their actions.

Could be better

Ok, for the sheer fact that this was a true story, and it needed to be told, and it's really a fascinating tale, I could have made a better film with a iphone, a bath tub and a model battleship. The last 5 minutes were the best of the film, (minus the fact that former Pres. Bill Clinton was speaking). They never once show the ship as a whole they are filming on. They make it look like the ship is departing the dock, by means of moving the camera along, BUT OOOPS, there's the anchor line still attatched to the ship. There is an ignorant predjudicial CPO who is the bad guy at various moments, he throws the "colored" sailors dog over board, but is not busted, just transfered, and then as he departs the ship, with full rank, he turns and tells the crew with the white Captain right there that he hopes they all die. HAHAHAHAHA! C'mon man, really? If this was Ossie Davis's last film credit, I hope he passed before he got to see the finished project. I love war movies, cheesy, old, or out dated, but this was PATHETIC! Don't waste your time. And if you want to buy it for the collection, let me know, I got one only watched once for half price.
Good movie and it's good to see what happened in our history.
I enjoyed the movie. A story well told.
"C-movie"

A story about most interesting times told in a most uninteresting way.

The movie feels more like a political propaganda than anything else. Awfully primitive characters, boring lines full of tearful speeches and excessive use of voice-over just add to the effect. Characters are so simple and so wonderful, always smiling, clean and nice, so perfect in every way that it's almost a parody. There is hardly anything happening in the movie. No twists in the plot, no surprises. Characters are either good or bad, like in a child book. No room for dilemmas. Nothing to think about, no challenges for the viewer. Everything is obvious.

Racism is bad, patriotism is good - that's basically the entire movie. I'm not kidding, it's all.

It's as if the script was written by 12 years old idealistic american boy. It's not a movie, it's a commercial.

So, if you didn't know before that racism is bad and hate movies to make you think or give you hard problems to ponder about, then by all means watch "Proud".

In any other case stay away. It's a complete waste of time.
I love to see history come to life in such an inspirational way.
i liked this movie.
Corny, boring and poorly written and poorly acted. Still it's best the story was told instead of not.

Loved this movie as it is a part of our history that may do not know exists.  This new inventive style of story telling is a refreshing spin that al ages well enjoy, especially together as a family. Well made and an excellent cast

This is a true story and I found it very in lighting concerning truth that was pushed away. Not unlike other movies concerning the same subject - A squadron's of Airman in England and artilleryman in one of the biggest battle of WWII

Proud was a little hokie at times, but I did enjoy the movie

Movie has potential, the storyline is a little slow.  The thing I really disliked is the continual bombardment of white prejudice.  Although things were very hard on the blacks during WWII, it really distracted from the great accomplishments of the great Sailors of the USS Mason.  Through there was racism, many Americans were grateful for the service of all Americans Soldiers, Sailors and Airmen.  There are great war stories of Japanese-American, African-Americans, Jews, Germans, etc. and their trials and tribulations without trying to overwhelm us with a hate message to evoke a reaction and distract from the true accomplishments and heroism of all who participated in the war.  Anyways, it was very distracting and a little too much in my opinion.
great story did not know about it.
Little known story of a fine little ship and her crew.  Well acted by a veteran cast.
Great
Ok
Inspirational

Interesting and important subject let down by TV movie of the week production values. I like the story too bad there was not a higher budget for production of this film. Stock WW2 footage is interspersed throughout and was the most interesting to me. The battle scenes filmed for this film were not believable and lacked realism. A regrettable phase of U.S. history deserves a better effort.

Excellent movie! I found it informative and encouraging. I have a grave disregard for racism and this movie helps anyone with wisdom to see what we can do to not be that way. And, I really love the heroes of this film.
This movie does these men a great honor.

This film tells one of those small side stories that are the only way to understand our history. Watch this. If you like jingoistic patriotism, you'll be pleased. If you are a racist... you may have your thinking changed... or be asked to leave the ship. This film should be shown in every HS history class in the country.

This was an eye opening account of just what African American sailors went through.
I strongly recommend this one.
Not the greatest of films, but enjoyable and informative about African Americans in the service during WW2.

The only problem I had with this film is that it's description isn't accurate.  The Mason was a destroyer escort not a battleship.  A correct description would have called it a "war ship"  rather than a "battleship".
  Beyond that, I found this to be a great piece of "forgotten" history.  Its a shame that these men, who served their country so honorably had to wait so long to receive their commendations.  How much of our country's history has our military hidden just because of the color of the man's skin?  How often do people have to prove that one man is just as good as the next?  I was glad to see that in the end, these men finally get their commendations.  But what about the men who have passed since the original recommendation was turned in?  They deserve the same respect as those still living from all of us.  I was glad to see that the grandson didn't give up on going after what he and his friends believed his granddad deserved.
  All in all, I found this to be a great movie and would recommend it to everyone who is interested in learning as much as they can about our country's ENTIRE history!!!!!!
Loved it!
ARRIVED ON TIME AND THE DISC PLAYED FLAWLESS.  THANK YOU

I had no problem with the movie itself, I'm just thankful that it worked.  The case was torn-up upon arrival, and the disk was scratched & dirty. Maybe that's what I get for buying used, but it was not what I expected having selected one labeled "like new".

Based on the true and heroic story of the USS Mason, a Navy battleship manned by an African-American crew during WWII, when segregation was still enforced. Based on the book by Mary Pat Kelly.

The pros

Some pretty solid performances by the cast. Some scenes were very enjoyable. Nice to see a all African American cast and no one is a drug dealer,pimp or thug. Glad to see these events portrayed on film. The scene with them visiting some Irish people was very enjoyable. Footage of actual navy vessels in battle. Ending of the film has footage of Bill Clinton talking with some of the surviving crew members.

The cons
I hated how they couldn't decide if they wanted to be documentary or a movie. You have Ossie Davis talking all over the film explaining things I don't need that just show what happened in the film. Man the sets were kind of cheap in the film. You could tell they didn't have much money for this film. I didn't get some of the choices in term of script. They wasted a lot of time with one character interviewing other charters in the film. This happened a few times. I'd have rather they spent this time doing something more interesting. Also during the battle scenes they use actually footage of real navy ships in battle. This would be cool if the scenes weren't in black and white. I found this really jarring at times. It really took me out of the battles. Also the main antagonist who was causing them problems get taken out of the picture 40% into the film. I know it's based on real life,but it hurt the film. You don't get rid of the main bad guy so soon.

In conclusion I'd say good idea with poor execution. Don't know why some people gave it such a high rating,but don't be fooled.
The product was like new, the movie wasn't as good as i thought it would be.

This is an awesome movie!!! My family and I enjoyed watching this movie and plan to let our other family members view this movie over the holidays... It was educational and a good look at history. I do recommend everyone trying this movie.

I just want to say that I am glad that I ordered this DVD from Amazon.  It is a very good and informative movie.  I was getting ready to watch a DVD one night and this movie was one of the preview movies before my movie started.  I don't even remember which movie it was on now.  I did not know anything about the USS Mason and its crew until I ordered the movie and watched it.  Ossie Davis, Darnell Williams and the other actors in the movie were astounding.  This movie can also be used as something for Black History Month because it is Black History.  In all, I think everyone should see this movie regardless of who you are.
Proud was ok. I was expecting the movie to give more indepth account of the crew aboard the USS Mason.

I served in the U.S. Navy during the Korea war. I know what shipboard life is like. The men on the Mason had it about as rough as it gets. One of the Navy's smallest ships on the roughest seas. They called this an experiment for the Navy. I don't know if the Navy claims to have proven their point, but those black sailors sure proved theirs. Considering the excellent job that those men did the Navy should have manned other ships with an all black crews. I'm white, and a southern boy at that, but we southerners recognize a job well done. And this makes me very proud of my black shipmates. You know the saying, YOU CAN"T KEEP A GOOD MAN DOWN.

This is an amazing story of several young African American men who help gain recognition to the older African American men who served on a Naval vessel who did remarkable voyages to help their country.

This is one of the best movies about World War 2 I have seen.  It is a film that makes me very Proud to be a part of this great country.  It is the story of a group of African Americans who fought for their country and fought against prejudice in the land of immigrants.  It is so unfortunate that it took the United States Navy so long to recognize the valor and courage of these young men.  I would recommend this movie anyone who is interested in the History of the our Great Nation, the United States of America.

Outstanding little film! Ossie Davis is loveable as Lorenzo DeFau, and as narrator, draws us right into the story of the crew of the USS Mason.  It is the true story of how the first all-African American crew overcame prejudice and adversity while risking their lives for this country during World War II. The film tells the story very well, and is interspersed with actual black and white footage of the original USS Mason crew. The cinematography is exceptional, especially the scenes shot in Derry, Ireland. This is Tommy Hilfiger's first motion picture effort from his THEntertainment production company. Note there are several cameos throughout the film, including Tommy and Ally Hilfiger, Nobel Peace winner John Hume, and the three main characters who are still living: Lorenzo DeFau, Gordon Buchanan, and James Graham. It is a tribute and a wonderful, uplifting family film. I think everyone should see it!

First of all, the Editorial comments description needs to be corrected - the Mason was  not a Battleship, it was a Destroyer Escort.

We stumbled on this movie by accident and were interested because my father had served on a DE in WWII.  It was a wonderfully told story of a truth of WWII that many have never heard about. I was educated by this movie - and found it to be for the most part well acted & also entertaining.

Great story and storytelling about the African American service men  in WWII. Finally someone has decided to show the true things they had to overcome and resistance along the way. Great movie, especially for teachers in the classroom.
Very good movie/docudrama of the TRUE story of a DE in WW2.
My husband loves this movie, would purchase again.
